data.title: Make doc_status output a bit more markdown-friendly, hide some prints
DocData: Fix enums for proxy classes
Display of color in debugger
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Ubuntu 16.04 LTS, Godot 3.0, Intel HD Graphics 5500

**Issue description:**
Display of color in debugger gets text "ERROR" repeated put on top of it.
Expected was display of that color without transparency

**Steps to reproduce:**

```
var red = Color8(255, 0, 0, 0)

func _ready():
    pass
```

Set a breakpoint at the 'pass' statement and look at the member 'red' in the debugger when running the scene.
The color itself is 'shown' (transparency is 100% in this example), but it also gets the text "ERROR" displayed on top of that.
Maybe alpha should be 1.0 (or 255) for drawing a color in the debugger, what would it actually show behind the debugger itself ?

![screenshot from 2017-09-16 12-25-51](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2351444/30511457-df7f3d7e-9ad9-11e7-8a00-0e73fc65a4ec.png)

data.title: Adds _OS::PowerState enum
Rasterizer crashes whilst loading editor on Intel HD 3000 (regression from 90445aae)
data.body:
Mac OS X 10.9.5, MacBook Air, Intel HD Graphics 3000 384 MB.

Godot master 277d9d6aa703700e722d068842705f0d405f3913.

Godot crashes when loading into the editor (eg. after creating a new project in the launcher and selecting it).

No additional steps required.

**I have found that reverting the following commit actually fixes the issue for me:**

https://github.com/godotengine/godot/commit/90445aae67159adafbcbb5a0027d1e793d6ea7ef

However I do not fully understand the consequences of reverting this commit, or whether it's truly responsible for the crash or if it's just essentially disabling a particular code path and the actual problem is elsewhere. Either way, I hope this will at least provide a clue.

I'll post the output and callstack from the crash in a follow-up post.

data.title: Don't allow boolean values in math contexts
data.body:
After discussion on how best to fix an editor crash related to constant
expression simplification it was decided to just not allow boolean
values in mathematical contexts. This means that from now on we no
longer allow things like bool - bool, bool / bool etc. to be valid
GDScript.

This fixes #11291 

It seems clang-format chokes on this file a bit, I'll make another PR to fix that.

There is a reproducible crash when editing scripts.

Steps to reproduce:

2) Select all (ctrl+a)
3) Hit ctrl+u twice

data.title: Stop GUI touch event propagation
data.body:
Mouse events on `Control` nodes are properly consumed by default. This way if a button or other `Control` with `ignore_mouse` = **false** is clicked, the event is accepted and never sent through `_unhandled_input` functions. Currently this does not apply to touch events, so tapping a button on a mobile device will still send the event to `_input` as well as `_unhandled_input`, which causes conflicts between custom game inputs and tapping UI buttons. 

This PR solves this issue by explicitly checking touch events separately from mouse events. It is designed to work with multitouch.

A `stop_touch` flag has also been added, but to be honest I didn't notice any behavior difference with  `stop_mouse`. I only added it for good measure and the ability to handle touch events separately from mouse events in such a case.

----

Tested on OSX with `emulate_touchscreen`=**true**, Android, and iOS on top of **2.1.3-stable** AND **2.1.4-stable** builds

data.title: Make clickable properly in editor help
data.body:
fixes #3671

```cpp
p_mode == PROCESS_POINTER && r_click_item && itp && !it && p_click_pos.y > p_ofs.y + y + lh
```
This condition is also true with table cell.
`r_click_item` will be the first cell shown on screen.
if no table cell on screen, click or drag works.

in Godot 3.0 help,
- clicking empty space goes to undesired position with **Members**
- clicking **Public Method** does not work.
- dragging selection is not working if any **Members** or **Public Method** table is on screen.

Here is current version demo.
![richtext_1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8281454/30495176-df2f86d4-9a85-11e7-8e61-66888e6d417f.gif)

This is fixed version demo.
![richtext_2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8281454/30495184-eb75d6d2-9a85-11e7-89b5-071d2fd91e07.gif)

data.title: Joy axis out of size, ipega controller on android
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Android, Ipega gamepad controller, Godot 2.1

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->

Testing ipega gamepad joystick axis on android produces the following errors, just moving the joystick. It happens with left and right thumbstick, L2 and R2, and Dpad.

` ERROR: joy_axis: Index p_axis out of size (JOY_AXIS_MAX). `

One of the thumbstick (the left one) is recognized as `JOYSTICK_MOTION` event type, and it can print the axis `print(event.axis)`, but the other one is not recognized as such, even though error described above.

The input state of this gamepad is

apart from GDScript because the JSON class wasn't exposed to ClassDB.

data.title: Specify sampler precision where missing
data.body:
Sampler types other than `sampler2D` and `samplerCube` don't have default precision, so specify where missing.
Reported for CubeMap filter shader in #11197

data.title: boolean divided by 0 kills godot
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Linux 64 bit Fedora 26, Godot 2.1.4

**Issue description:**
when the editor tries to interpret a function which divides true (or false) and 0 (or false) the whole godot process is killed.

this is a problem when copying examples from the documentation. [example](http://docs.godotengine.org/en/stable/learning/features/viewports/viewports.html#scale-stretching)

**Steps to reproduce:**
open the script editor and insert the following lines:
```
func test():
#    true/0
```
then delete the # character

note: dividing 1/0 inside the function doesn't kill the process
